column2: PRESIDENT JOE BIDEN---Day99---DAY 100 with the INAUGURATION DAY---Evening Shade-Thursday
column5: YOU WILL FIND in the DIARIES a LOT of POLITICS AND EVEN MORE CATS     THE PERSON who MAKES the FIRST COMMENT WILL GET TWO CATS EVERY PERSON WHO COMMENTS WILL GET A CAT     RULES IN THE DIARY WHEN YOU FIND SOMETHING in the DIARY that you LIKE YOU CAN REPOST IT AS COMMENT in the DIARY  PRESIDENT JOE BIDEN The Bidens just finished their meeting with Jimmy and Rosalynn Carter in Georgia according to the pool report.  A coalition of immigration advocacy groups is launching a $50 million effort aimed at defending President Biden on immigration and pressuring lawmakers from both parties to pass a pathway to citizenship. https://t.co/uv3xXubLtX  NBC's @craigmelvin: Were you aware of the Giuliani raid before it happened?Biden: "I give you my word I was not. I made a pledge I would not interfere in ... any investigation the Justice Dept. had underway. I learned about that last night when the rest of the world" did.  Today marks President Biden's 100th day in office.  SUPREME COURT The Supreme Court just sided with an undocumented Guatemalan immigrant seeking to challenge his removal from the U.S. by immigration authorities. https://t.co/76zJsvsig0  AFGHANISTAN The U.S. military withdrawal from Afghanistan is now formally underway according to the White House and several U.S. defense officials. https://t.co/HHlSd4VJ1X  LEADER SCHUMER Just on @MSNBC: Ben Crump Bakari Sellers and the family of George Floyd just met for an hour with Leader Schumer to discuss police reform. @NBCNews  SPEAKER PELOSI Speaker Pelosi: "It was the first time two women the Vice President of the United States and the Speaker of the House sat behind the president as he delivered his address to the nation. It sent the message to girls and women that beyond the sky is the limit."  Speaker Pelosi to CBS on Republicans: "All of a sudden they're deficit hawks when they were giving away money to the wealthiest people in our country under President Trump."  SENATE Breaking: The Senate has just passed the Drinking Water and Wastewater Infrastructure Act of 2021 89-2.The 'no' votes were Ted Cruz and Mike Lee.  VAL DEMINGS Politico Playbook: It's sounding increasingly likely that Rep. Val Demings wants to run against Republican Ron DeSantis in 2022 according to two sources who've spoken with her."At this point it's more likely than not that she does run."  JUDICIAL NOMINEES Democrats have begun advancing Biden's first judicial nominees taking a significant step to counter Trump's influence on the courts.In a marked contrast the two circuit court nominees and three district court candidates were all people of color. https://t.co/AqMCWOBUxQ  GOP LAWMAKER Last night a GOP lawmaker and ex-sheriff offered his experience to help Biden's efforts on criminal justice reform."I want to help with the criminal justice reform ... It's needed I don’t know how to reach out to you."Biden: "I'll reach out to you."https://t.co/sgFEE3yFfd  GIULIANI Breaking NYT: At least one of the Giuliani warrants was seeking evidence related to Marie Yovanovitch.Federal authorities were expected to scour devices for communications between Giuliani and Trump officials about the ambassador before she was recalled.https://t.co/RC2b9O1Ube  At issue for investigators is a key question: Did Giuliani go after Yovanovitch solely on behalf of Trump who was his client at the time? Or was he also doing so on behalf of the Ukrainian officials who wanted her removed for their own reasons? https://t.co/UOBbB6ETmq  Andrii Artemenko a former Ukrainian parliamentarian tells Politico that he has shared what he knows about Rudy Giuliani with federal investigators. https://t.co/VqtjHKsjCD  Giuliani's long quest to put himself in legal jeopardy appears to have paid off. https://t.co/CkWjbtkQq0  MN Star Tribune: Justice Department officials plan to ask a grand jury to indict Derek Chauvin and the other three ex-officers involved in George Floyd's killing on charges of civil rights violations. https://t.co/zUAaz8iqbc  GEORGIA Georgia Democratic state Rep. Matthew Wilson has launched a campaign for insurance commissioner that would make him Georgia's first openly LGBTQ statewide elected official if he wins. https://t.co/5Hs6tTaeL7  VIRGINIA 'A lot of confusion': Virginia Republicans are stumbling over their own voter ID requirements."It's 'Lord of the Flies' in the Virginia GOP right now."https://t.co/qwOZsP8LV0
